# linearGravity()

**Type Method**

Creates a field that accelerates objects in a specific direction.

## Declaration

```swift
class func linearGravity() -> SCNPhysicsField
```

## Return Value

A physics field object. To use the field in a scene, attach it to the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNNode/physicsField] property of an [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNNode] object.

## Discussion

Because the force of gravity on an object is proportional to the object’s mass, this force accelerates all objects in the field’s area of affect by the same amount. The field’s [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsField/strength] property measures this acceleration in meters per second per second.

By default, a linear gravity field accelerates objects in along its [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsField/direction] vector. To make it accelerate objects in the opposite direction, set the field’s [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsField/strength] property to a negative value.

The default [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsField/falloffExponent] value for a linear gravity field is `0.0`, indicating that the field’s effect is constant throughout its area of effect.

## Creating Physics Fields

- **drag()**: Creates a field that slows any object in its area of effect with a force proportional to the object’s velocity.
- **vortex()**: Creates a field whose forces circulate around an axis.
- **radialGravity()**: Creates a field that accelerates objects toward its center.
- **noiseField(smoothness:animationSpeed:)**: Creates a field that applies random forces to objects in its area of effect.
- **turbulenceField(smoothness:animationSpeed:)**: Creates a field that applies random forces to objects in its area of effect, with magnitudes proportional to those objects’ velocities.
- **spring()**: Creates a field that pulls objects toward its center with a spring-like force.
- **electric()**: Creates a field that attracts or repels objects based on their electrical charge and on their distance from the field’s center.
- **magnetic()**: Creates a field that attracts or repels objects based on their electrical charge, velocity, and distance from the field’s axis.
